definition: to grab/to snatch up/variant of 焯[chao1]
to grab/to snatch up/variant of 焯[chao1]
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me

sentences.english: Two significant digits is good enough.
sentences.chinese: 個有效數應該綽綽有餘了。

sentences.english: Don't worry about daily expenses, we have enouh and to spare.
sentences.chinese: 不必擔心日常開支，我們綽綽有餘。

sentences.english: As he does so, Skiles has been enjoying the luxury of time.
sentences.chinese: 眼下，斯科爾斯的時間綽綽有餘，他很從容。

sentences.english: The big tables enable all books to be laid out with ease.
sentences.chinese: 這些桌子很大，把所有的書攤在上面還綽綽有餘。

sentences.english: There were eight or ten; and there was abundance of room for them in our great pilot-house.
sentences.chinese: 約有八到十人吧，我們的大駕駛室容納他們綽綽有餘。

sentences.english: For a sales meeting, two or three people are more than enough.
sentences.chinese: 對銷售會議來說，兩三個人就綽綽有餘了。

definition: fears of trouble in the rear (idiom); family worries (obstructing freedom of action)/worries about the future consequences/often in negative expressions, meaning "no worries about anything"
proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
to ask a price/to charge/asking price
out with the old and in with the new (idiom)
